subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Ottoman Empire: Islam's Longest Dynasty
description: A fast breakdown of The Ottoman Empire: Islam's Longest Dynasty for builders.

hook.text: Six centuries, three continents, one dynasty. The Ottomans ruled the Muslim world longer than any empire in history.

buildup.text: Founded in 1299 in Turkey, the Ottoman Empire conquered Constantinople in 1453, ending the Byzantine Empire.

discovery.text: Suleiman the Magnificent made the Ottomans a global superpower. Art, law, and architecture flourished under his rule.

twist.text: The Ottomans were tolerant. Christians and Jews had protected status. Religious minorities thrived for centuries.

climax.text: The Ottoman Empire fell in 1922, creating the modern Middle East. Its borders and legacies still shape the region.

punchline.text: Six centuries of Ottoman rule shaped the Middle East we see today.

quiz.question: How long did the Ottoman Empire last?
